meanings.definition: The quality of being manageable or easy to control or handle.
meanings.sent1: The manageableness of the new software made it simple for everyone to use.
meanings.sent2: The teacher appreciated the manageableness of the class, as they were well-behaved and attentive.
meanings.sent3: The manageableness of the puppy was put to the test when it found a squeaky toy.
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor added a sense of manageableness to the chaotic situation.
meanings.sent5: The manageableness of the workload allowed her to finish all her tasks ahead of schedule.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of being able to be managed or dealt with effectively.
meanings.sent1: The manageableness of the project made it easy to complete on time.
meanings.sent2: The manageableness of the situation allowed for a quick resolution.
meanings.sent3: The manageableness of the traffic jam was surprising, as they reached their destination early.
meanings.sent4: His leadership skills greatly contributed to the manageableness of the team.
meanings.sent5: The manageableness of the budget made it possible to allocate funds efficiently.
